Instruction: Heat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius).

Combine flour, baking powder, salt, and black pepper in a bowl. Mix in olive oil and cold water until a soft dough forms. Shape the dough into logs, cut into 2-inch pieces, and space evenly on baking sheets.

Bake on the middle rack in the preheated oven for 15 minutes; flip the biscuits and continue baking until both sides are golden brown, about 15 minutes more. Allow the biscuits to cool on waxed paper, then store them in a sealed container and refrigerate overnight for optimal flavor.
Monitor the oven while baking. Check at 10 minutes, and bake additional 10 minutes if needed.
